message:
I was thinking along the same lines! Definitely no excuse for locking them in their rooms, but I work with special needs kids. A lot of special needs kids have eating disorders. I knew a kid who would get up at all hours of the night and raid the fridge.
[...Content omitted due to length constraints...]
very overweight. His mom finally had to buy a lock (not a chain, but they do make refrigerator locks you use a padlock with) so she could control the food intake. I didn't see anywhere in the article where it mentioned whether they were malnourished. Wish it had more information.

message: If gays were running around saying that Catholics """"shall surely be put to death"""" the Catholics would be apoplectic with paranoia. They'd be screaming """"VICTIM"""" as loud as possible, to anyone who would listen. And yet gays are just supposed to put up with this kind of threat? Why should we have to put up with such hateful rhetoric? Because the Catholics don't really mean it? IF THE CATHOLICS DON""""T MEAN IT, THEN WHY DO THEY KEEP SAYING IT?
